for 5, I vision a system for indicating trust level on zeronet objects, zites, users: it'd be like web of trust like we do it in GPG. you yourself set the trust level on users/zites, you own/fully-trust/limitedly-trust/know/dont-know/deny/etc. on a scale. But keep calm, not on every zite of course, that would be ridiculous :)

Mark zites which you are confident that you trust. for example your friend directly showed it to you.
the strength of this system would be that trust level propagate to you via people/zites you know. the more you trust a user the more weighted you "get" from his trustee. 

I try to model this system mimicing human in-real-life concept of trustness.

for example a zite's trust level (for you) is 0+10F/15K+50T/100K (for someone else it may be different), which means you don't know the zite directly (0), but 10 of your closest acquaintances fully trust (10F) and 15 other of them just simply know the zite (15K), and 50 less known people limitedly trust (50T) and 100 similarly known people just know the zite (100K).

the notation definitedly should be improved to comprehend easier. for example this distance-from-you/trust-level map can be graphically represented which people understand almost unconsciously.

I very much want to develop people out of the current concept of trusting online entities. today we see green padlock and we're like "what i read here is and was always will be _the_ _naked_ _truth_" and when seeing gray/red padlock then "i must immediatedly go away. i am in physical danger here". probably you who read this lines here on zeronet, you are not people like this, and maybe i'm a little bit exaggregating, but you get the point. the 3-state "traffic lamp" concept of trustness is very misleading, a lie. Even for 2 people, the trustness of a certain 3rd party can be different: you trust in your brother-in-law in a certain level, but me as your coworker I trust him somewhat less. It's sensible way to describe online entities (in terms of trust) because it's the natural IRL way to do so.

I admit my vision is incomplete. I call you to improve it. 

Returning to the trust level indicator, it may be enough to plot 3 layers (beyond you) to show trusted, known, and unknown people's trust level on a given entity, eg. on a zite. In the example above there are 2 layers plus you. In this way you straight see that how many of your closest acquaintances trust the zite how much, then how much the people they know trust the zite, and then come those people's credits who are in the 3rd grade of distance from you.
Tuning the details of the model and representing it in a good form makes the system very usable in my opinion.

I hope I'm somewhat understood.
cheers
